conclusion: Understanding the problem with cube side length a, refractive index n = 1.5, and bubble at center.
Calculate critical angle C using sin C = 1/n, resulting in C = arcsin(2/3).
Bubble is at the center, distance to any face is a/2, light must be internally reflected.
Determine minimum area by ensuring light rays from bubble are internally reflected.
Calculate radius of cone on face using tan C = sin C / cos C, resulting in tan C = 2/sqrt(5).
Calculate radius of circle on face as a/sqrt(5) and area as π(a/sqrt(5))^2 = πa^2/5.
Conclude minimum area of paper is πa^2/4.
